review_title: This company looks great on the surface
job_title: Direct Support Professional (DSP) in Yakima, WA
pros:
There is only one pro in Community Living.

You can put a smile on the faces of DDA clients
cons: Too many hands in the honey pot. No 2 members of the office have the same answer and will write you up for doing what they ask you to do. HCA is required to do this job and they will not license. If you go to get your HCA on your own the company openly states that they don't recognize it or any other license or certificate including CNA.

review_title: Clients are great, office staff not so muc
job_title: Direct Support Professional (DSP) in Clarkston, WA
pros: Working with clients is awesome and rewarding.
cons: Office staff ignore staff working with clients. Trying to get any response is like pulling teeth. Communication is severely lacking. Going into the office is like stepping into high school. Things that should be confidential aren't. A major change in office staff is what is needed to make this company a better place to work for. Also hiring better qualified people to do this type of work. You can't just hire someone because they say they enjoy working with people. They need to be better qualified.

pros: The residents are warm, caring, and helpful individuals whom just want to be part of a family whom loves them!!
cons: Some of the employees are not good at their jobs as a DSP and cause work relating problems amongst employees. They can get easily frustrated with the individuals and do not handle situations properly. They do not work together as a team.

review_title: Run like it's a burning building
pros: You directly impact the lives of people who otherwise have no friends, limited family contact, and no ability to care for themselves. It is honorable work, if frustrating.
cons:
The houses are filthy.
The coordinator is racist.
The management sees itself as "above you workers," and that is an exact quote I have heard many times.
Change does not come without great effort, and only if their is money to be made or saved.
They do NOT care about the grunt worker, the house managers bear all the work to be done while supervisors take the credit and none of the blame when things go south.
Stay. Away. Their turnover rate is so incredibly high for a reason-- those reasons.

review_title: Do not work here unless you love the human service field and don't mind very bad bosses.
pros: You get to actively take part in all the care and well being of the individuals you help. Without you, they would have no one.
cons:
The management is like a dead whale.
It stinks, it's ugly, it's driving everyone away, it's physically toxic and harmful, and nobody's done anything with it since it washed up on shore.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Peters, MO
pros: Very nice environment to work.  Management was easily approachable.  Good benefits, including a generous 401k match.  I felt that they really cared about their employees and the services that they provided.
cons: Pay is lower in some areas, but that is to be expected since they are a not-for-profit

cons: The organization of the company was not what I expected.  I was hired to perform one job and became a taxi service more or less.
